assertion: Natural contraceptive methods prevent ovum and sperm from meeting.
reason: These methods involve avoiding coitus during the fertile period.

assertion: Periodic abstinence involves avoiding coitus from day 10 to 17 of menstrual cycle.
reason: Ovulation and highest chance of fertilisation occur during this phase.

assertion: Withdrawal method prevents insemination by male partner withdrawing before ejaculation.
reason: This ensures semen does not enter the female reproductive tract.

assertion: Lactational amenorrhea prevents conception due to absence of menstruation during lactation.
reason: Intense lactation suppresses ovulation after childbirth.

assertion: Lactational amenorrhea is effective indefinitely after childbirth.
reason: Ovulation never resumes in breastfeeding mothers.

assertion: Natural methods have almost nil side effects.
reason: No medicines or devices are used in these methods.
Failure chances in these methods are negligible.

assertion: Barrier methods prevent physical meeting of ovum and sperm.
reason: They use physical devices to block sperm entry into the female tract.

assertion: Condoms are thin rubber or latex sheaths used before coitus.
reason: They cover penis in males or cervix in females to prevent semen entry.

assertion: 'Nirodh' is a popular female condom brand in India.
reason: It is inserted into the vagina to block sperm entry.

assertion: Condoms also protect against sexually transmitted infections (STIs) and AIDS.
reason: They act as a barrier preventing exchange of infectious body fluids.

assertion: Diaphragms, cervical caps and vaults block sperm entry through the cervix.
reason: They are reusable rubber devices placed in the female reproductive tract.

assertion: Spermicidal creams, jellies and foams decrease contraceptive efficiency.
reason: They kill sperms and are often used with barrier devices.

assertion: Intra Uterine Devices (IUDs) are inserted into the uterus via the vagina.
reason: They are placed by trained doctors or expert nurses.

assertion: Lippes loop is a copper releasing IUD.
reason: Copper ions released reduce sperm motility and fertilising capacity.

assertion: CuT, Cu7 and Multiload 375 are examples of copper releasing IUDs.
reason: Copper ions suppress sperm motility and fertilising capacity.

assertion: Progestasert and LNG-20 are hormone releasing IUDs.
reason: Hormones released prevent conception by altering uterine environment.

assertion: IUDs increase phagocytosis of sperms in the uterus.
